newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran's non-oil exports reach $3.1 mln last year.
newsitem.headline: Iran's non-oil exports reach $3.1 mln last year.

text.p: Iran's non-oil exports reached $3.1 billion dollars last year, a 1.4 percent increase over the previous year, the Iranian news agency IRNA said on Saturday.
Ali Saidlu, head of Iran's export promotion centre, told IRNA exports covered industrial and agricultural goods.
It was not clear if he was referring to the current Iranian year which ended on March 20.

"The figure will be close to $5 billion, if the hard cash earned from export of technical and engineering sevices, shipping and aviation services and transit of goods is taken into consideration," Saidlu added.
An oil price rally since last June is forcast to have earned Iran a bonus of up to $3.5 billion last year.
